oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tour buses in front of Davidson County Courthouse, Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1960s
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Tour buses, circa 1960s, at the Davidson County Courthouse in downtown Nashville, Tennessee. The Davidson County Courthouse, also known as Metropolitan Courthouse, is an Art Deco building built in 1936. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1987. It was designed by Nashville architect Emmons H. Woolwine and the firm of Dennison and Hirons of New York. Forms part of Record Group 3. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount).
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Davidson County Court House (Nashville, Tenn.)
